zone.line: Enduring thus the retributive hour
Which since we spake is even nearer now--
But hark the hell-hounds clamour, fear delay
lowers
Behold Heaven scowls under thy Father's frown.
Mercury
O that we might be spared--|I to inflict
And thou to suffer! once more answer me
When sayest thou the destined change arrivesx
Prometheus
it 190
I know but this, that they must come 176
Mercury Yet pause, &
Then plunge
Into Eternity, where recorded time
age age
Even all that we imagine, years on years
Seems but a point, and the reluctant mind
Flags wearily in its' unending flight
Till it sink, dizzy, blind, lost, shelterless;
Perchance it has not numbered the slow
years
Which thou must spend in torture, unreprieved.
Prometheus
pass
Perchance no thought can count them--yet they
